intro: Blakwellia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a glossy surface. Blakwellia longiflora is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
